definitions.definition: connected with a person’s mind and the way in which it works

examples.text: Abuse can lead to both psychological and emotional problems.
Her symptoms are more psychological than physical *(= imaginary rather than real)*.
Victory in the last game gave them **a psychological advantage** over their opponents.
a psychological novel *(= one that examines the minds of the characters)*
Everyone has their own personal and psychological needs.
Her latest movie is a tense psychological drama.

definitions.definition: connected with the study of psychology

examples.text: A psychological study of refugee children came up with some worrying results.

definitions.definition: the best time to do something in order for it to be successful

examples.text: The trick is in finding the (right) psychological moment to ask him for more money.
